intro: Wahlenbergia scopulicola, commonly known as the rock lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or coastal environments. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue or purple. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, adapted to withstand arid conditions. Wahlenbergia scopulicola is often found in coastal dunes and limestone formations, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
